title.narrative: Life-saving support to extremely vulnerable returnees in Unity state

description.narrative: - The beneficiaries includes men, women and children returnees in Guit and Koch Counties' of Unity State.

1. To enable vulnerable persons to meet basic food needs through cash for food 2. To provide access to safe and adequate clean water, appropriate and dignified sanitation facilities and hygiene promotion to the vulnerable populations.

Political conflict compounded economic woes, and the recent flooding has caused massive displacement and dire food shortages in South Sudan. An estimated 1.5 million people are displaced within the boundaries of South Sudan with an estimated 190,000 seeking refuge at the Protection of Civilian (POC) sites across the country. South Sudan is faced with acute needs. IPC report released in August 2019 projects 5.5 million people in crises (IPC Phase 3) or worse from January to April 2020, about 934,000 pregnant or lactating women are acutely malnourished and 1.23 million children under the age 5 years old are likely to be acutely malnourished. The 2020 South Sudan Humanitarian Response Plan estimated that 7.5 million people are in need of humanitarian assistance. Nevertheless, since the signing of the revitalized peace agreement between the government and warring factions in September 2018, relative peace and calmness across the country is maintained despite optimism on the formation of the transitional government which has further been pushed by 100 days to February 2020. These relative calm and peace since 2018 have triggered people to return to their villages with the hope and expectation of strengthened peace and stability by the formation of the transitional government in February 2020.
Guit and Koch are counties of former Unity State. The estimated population as of 2008 census of Guit and Koch are 74,863 and 33,004 respectively. Guit and Koch have been grossly affected by the conflict, displacement and recent flooding. The recent IPC report classified Guit county in Emergency (IPC Phase 4) and Koch County in Crises (IPC Phase 3) for January to April 2020 projection. In addition, both county’s lie in Crises (IPC Phase 3) for acute malnutrition for same projection. In the WASH Cluster severity mapping, Guit is in severity level 4 (Alert state with 86% people access water from unprotective source; 88% practice open defecation and 47% have suffered from WASH related disease in the last one month) and Koch in severity level 3 (Warning state with 63% of people access water from unprotective source; 90% practice open defecation and 18% have suffered from WASH related disease in the last one month) . This WASH Cluster severity classification is in terms of access to an improved water source, outbreak or prevalence of WASH related diseases especially watery diarrhoea and cholera hotspot and malnutrition prevalence. The dire situation in Guit and Koch county’s will be exacerbated with the reported arrival of tens of thousands of returnees in the last months of 2019. These returnees are arriving with nothing as their houses, infrastructure and livelihoods have been destroyed during the crises. Although Markets are functioning, people have no money to buy food. Many of the families have extremely low purchasing power. They are acutely food insecure and with no food stocks, putting more pressure on the available limited infrastructures and services like water, sanitation and health.

title.narrative: WSH-I4: Number of people having access to sufficient and safe water for domestic use

description.narrative: Access: maximum distance to water point 500m, queuing time less than 15min, filling time maximum 3 min/20 litres or as locally agreed. Water access should be during the whole period of implementation unless action is mostly related to building the local water delivery capacity. Sufficient: covering basic needs, i.e. 7.5-15 l/p/d or as locally agreed. Safe: 1) low risk of faecal contamination, 2) No faecal coliforms detectable in any 100-ml sample, 3) For piped water supplies, or for all water supplies at times of risk or presence of diarrhoea epidemic, water is treated with a disinfectant to achieve free chlorine residual at the tap of 0.5 mg per litre and turbidity is below 5 NTU, 4) If for a short period, water which is contaminated chemically or radiologically is used, no (significant probability of) negative health effect is (likely to be) detected. Domestic use: drinking, cooking and personal hygiene (incl. laundry)

title.narrative: Availability of, access to and consumption of food
FSC-I2: Number of people enabled to meet their basic food needs (non-cash)

description.narrative: Basic food needs: assistance, combined with beneficiaries' own resources, to international standard of 2100 kcal per person per day for the period of the action. Any kind of transfer modality (in-kind, voucher, cash) and combination thereof with objective to ensure immediate access to the necessary food commodities. This may include supplementary foods provided alongside general distribution for vulnerable people.

title.narrative: WSH-I6: Number of people reached with hygiene promotion/awareness raising activities

description.narrative: Hygiene promotion/awareness raising activities. Could be training, campaigns, radio broadcasts, flyers etc. Excludes the distribution of Hygiene/dignity kits that should be covered under WHS-I1.

title.narrative: WSH-I2: Number of people having access to dignified, safe, clean and functional excreta disposal facilities

description.narrative: Access: ratio (user/facility) of 1 toilet for a max. 20 people, distance < 50 metres from dwellings, or as locally agreed. Clean: regular cleaning and maintenance for public facilities. Dignified: Use of toilets respect cultural preference and is arranged by household(s) and/or segregated by sex. Unsafe facilities: unstable (unlined) pits with risk of collapse, pits accessible to vectors, pits contaminating water tables and poorly sited facilities which expose women and girls to attacks, especially at night. Functional facility: fully constructed, in working order and properly maintained, of a type and in a location acceptable to intended users, with hand washing facilities and anal cleansing material.
